nodes.name: clone
nodes.description: Create a shallow-copied clone of the object. Any nested objects or arrays will be copied by reference, not duplicated.

nodes.name: copy
nodes.description: Copy properties from one object to another object.

nodes.name: create
nodes.description: Create an object, if input is a direct object it just returns a copy of the object

nodes.name: defaults
nodes.description: Fill in undefined properties in object with values from the defaults objects, and return the object. As soon as the property is filled, further defaults will have no effect.

nodes.name: extend
nodes.description: Copy all of the properties in the source objects over to the destination object, and return the destination object. It's in-order, so the last source will override properties of the same name in previous arguments.

nodes.name: fill
nodes.description: Fills an object with key/value pairs. Both key and in are array ports. Key must be fed the key names, and in will contain the values.

nodes.name: group
nodes.description: Groups input into an array

nodes.name: groupBy
nodes.description: Groups an object by it's differentiator

nodes.name: has
nodes.description: Does the object contain the given property? You can use dot notation to dig deeper into the object.

phrases.active: Determining whether the object has property {{input.path}}

nodes.name: invert
nodes.description: Retrieves a copy of the object where the keys have become the values and the values the keys. For this to work, all of your object's values should be unique and string serializable

nodes.name: is
nodes.description: Determines if object an object is of a certain type

nodes.name: isArguments
nodes.description: Determines if object is an Arguments Object

nodes.name: isArray
nodes.description: Determines if object is an Array

nodes.name: isBoolean
nodes.description: Determines if object is a Boolean

phrases.active: Determining whether object is a boolean

nodes.name: isDate
nodes.description: Determines if object is a Date

phrases.active: Determining whether object is a Date

nodes.name: isElement
nodes.description: Determines if object is a DOM element.

nodes.name: isEmpty
nodes.description: Determines if object contains no values (no enumerable own-properties)

nodes.name: isEqual
nodes.description: Performs an optimized deep comparison between the two objects, to determine if they should be considered equal.

nodes.name: isFinite
nodes.description: Determines if object is a Finite Number

phrases.active: Determining whether object is a finite number

nodes.name: isFunction
nodes.description: Determines if object is a Function

phrases.active: Determining whether object is a function

nodes.name: isNaN
nodes.description: Determines if object is NaN

nodes.name: isNull
nodes.description: Determines if object is Null

nodes.name: isNumber
nodes.description: Determines if object is a Number

phrases.active: Determining whether object is a number

nodes.name: isObject
nodes.description: Determines if object is an Object

nodes.name: isRegExp
nodes.description: Determines if object is a RegExp

phrases.active: Determining whether object is a RegExp

nodes.name: isString
nodes.description: Determines if object is a String

phrases.active: Determining whether object is a string

nodes.name: isUndefined
nodes.description: Determines if object is Undefined

nodes.name: keys
nodes.description: Retrieve all the names of the object's properties

nodes.name: methods
nodes.description: Gets a sorted list of the names of every method in an object — that is to say, the name of every function property of the object

nodes.name: move
nodes.description: Moves properties within one object from one place to the other

nodes.name: omit
nodes.description: Return a copy of the object, filtered to omit the blacklisted keys (or array of keys)

nodes.name: oneOf
nodes.description: Selects a (nested) property outputing the first property available. data.in || data.that || .. etc. Sends an error of none of the properties matched.

nodes.name: pairs
nodes.description: Retrieve key value pairs from an object

nodes.name: pick
nodes.description: Output a copy of the object, filtered to only have values for the whitelisted keys (or array of valid keys)

nodes.name: router
nodes.description: Route packets based on a path, input index will result in same index on output. Route should be an array [path,match], multiple matchers can be added lik [[path,match],[path,match]] -> [0] route Router out [0] -> matched..

nodes.name: set
nodes.description: Set a property on an object, or else create a new object and set the property

nodes.name: transfer
nodes.description: Transfer a properties from one object to another object.

nodes.name: values
nodes.description: Retrieve all of the values of the object's properties
